level.text: Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, an applicant for a license to practice audiology shall furnish proof satisfactory to the Board that the applicant:

Graduated with a Master’s degree or a Doctoral degree (Ph.D. or Au.D.) in audiology from a recognized educational institution whose audiology program is accredited by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech Language Pathology, an accrediting body recognized by the United States Department of Education, or an equivalent accrediting body as determined by the Board;
Passed a qualifying examination that meets the requirements set forth in section 7806; and
Completed a period of supervised experience that meets the requirements set forth in section 7803.
Source: Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 4336, 4337 (May 20, 2011).
